abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Chittagong Water Supply
            Project will provide additional supplies of water to meet
            the needs of Chittagong's growing population and
            industry up to 1990. Included in the project are: a new
            water intake and treatment plant, six tubewells,
            modifications to an existing iron removal plant and pumping
            station to expand its treatment capacity, and associated
            distribution works. The project provides for about 14,000
            service connections with meters, some 1,500 public
            standpipes and two public water concessions, which are being
            introduced on an experimental basis. There is also a
            provision for training and engineering services for project
            supervision, and for preparation of an appropriate
            sewerage/sanitation plan. Direct benefits of regularly
            available wholesome water supplies and improved access to
            public hydrants will be supplemented by improvements in
            public health and environmental conditions.
